thread.title: From McDonald's to Wetherspoons - We reveal the 'unhealthiest' breakfast choices on the high street
thread.title_full: From McDonald's to Wetherspoons - We reveal the 'unhealthiest' breakfast choices on the high street

author: Janine Rasiah
title: From McDonald's to Wetherspoons - We reveal the 'unhealthiest' breakfast choices on the high street
text:
A sausage sandwich is not the healthiest breakfast option Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It's supposedly the most important meal of the day but not all breakfasts will get your morning off on the right foot. 
High street options can be packed full of calories, with some eating in to almost all of your daily allowance in one meal. 
According to a new study, a Wetherspoons large breakfast tops the heavyweight table for most unhealthy brekkie, with its 1,531 calories amounting to an eye-watering two thirds of your recommended amount for the entire day. 
Plus tucking in will also exceed your daily recommended salt amount by more than 300 per cent and contain more than double your daily intake of saturated fat. 
And other food chains don't fare much better according to the treated.com study reports Glasgow Live . Read More Wetherspoon's large breakfast contains the most saturated fat (Photo: Treated.com) Wetherspoon's large breakfast also contains the most calories (Photo: Treated.com) 
Researcher Dr Wayne Osborne rated the the 'unhealthiest' choices available in 11 major UK high street food outlets for High Street Chain Breakfasts: How Unhealthy Can They Be? 
The stats uncover the whopping amount of salt, sugar, saturated fat and calories in options from Greggs, Burger King and Pret a Manger. 
Second on the calories countdown is Harvester's ultimate breakfast bap which contains 1,307 calories and 29.4 grams of saturated fat - well over your recommended intake of 20 grams. 
Harvester also serves the breakfast with the most sugar - its Belgian waffles with chargrilled fresh pineapple and watermelon drizzled with maple flavoured syrup and Greek style yoghurt contains 77.4 grams, over three quarters of your daily recommendation of 90 grams. Read More Harvester's Belgian waffles contain the most sugar (Photo: Treated.com) Wetherspoon's large breakfast contains the most salt (Photo: Treated.com) 
Porridge might sound like a healthy option but the MOMA! version with banana and honey - available in Wetherspoons - contains a staggering 64.3 grams of sugar, even more than McDonald's pancakes and sausage with syrup, which contains 53 grams. 
The Wimpy all day breakfast is another one to avoid if you're on a health kick. It contains 900 calories and 8.3 grams of saturated fat. 
It's almost enough to put you off your breakfast. Like us on Facebook
